text: I'd like to pay tribute to two Giants of
American culture figures whose influence
continues to resonate even 30 years
after they did their most characteristic
and important work mr. Chuck if you look
around these days you see Harold and
Kumar you see weeds on cable you see a
movie like the pineapple Express or The
Wackness people are toking up and
getting baked just about everywhere on
small screens and large and none of it
would exist without the pioneering
example of Cheech and Chong that is
Cheech Marin and Thomas Chong who
started out on the countercultural
college campus stand-up circuit recorded
a bunch of very funny albums in the
1970s and then took their act up to the
big screen starting in 1978 up and
smoked the movies include still smoking
and Cheech & Chong's next movie now I'm
not going to tell you that any of these
is a cinematic masterpiece or that you
even need to watch any of them which are
all available on DVD from beginning to
end in fact they don't make any more
sense
watch sequentially as they would if you
just mix them up and watch random scenes
basically what tends to happen most of
these scenes is Cheech and Chong are
driving around getting stoned
sooner or later wouldn't you know it the
cops show up
now the joke there is that that van is
made entirely out of marijuana so that
that highway patrolman when he inhaled
the fumes coming off the exhaust pipe
actually got a little high
what do you guys what not all of the
humor is drug-related there are some
jokes about politics about immigration
for example there's a song that's cheat
writes that's a protest song and also a
send-up of a protest song and also
probably a song that he and Chong made
up right about when the camera started
rolling the kind of humor that you see
in these movies is very loose and
improvisational and often seems
directionless what's fascinating to me
about watching teach and cheong together
is that the usual frictions that you see
that drive buddy comedy doesn't really
exist these guys are too baked and too
distracted to really be in very much
conflict so instead they're almost like
characters in the Samuel Beckett play
driving around this Los Angeles
landscape and if you just sort of
surrender to this vibe and this buzz
it's actually kind of fun
in all of his care go up in smoke
hi
